fields.summary: [Go][Parquet] Port the C++ Parquet implementation to Go

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

worklogs.comment:
zeroshade opened a new pull request #12149:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12149


   This is the last large portion of code to get merged. anything after this is individual bug fixes or improvements. With the exception of features that aren't yet implemented in Go (like Dictionary Arrays and such) this brings the Go Parquet library pretty much to mostly feature parity with the C++ Parquet Library.


--

drauschenbach commented on pull request #12149:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12149#issuecomment-1025968885


   I'm looking to get up to speed on the Go bindings through this PR, and so far I can get most of the tests to run (not including ones that require a `PARQUET_TEST_DATA` dir, which I'm not sure what to specify):
   
   ```sh
   $ ci/scripts/go_build.sh `pwd`
   $ cd go; go get -v ./...
   (no failures)
   ```
   
   But I'm struggling to kick the tires on the `parquet_reader` and `parquet_schema` commands. I've tried a few Parquet files and get the same result:
   
   ```sh
   $ ~/go/bin/parquet_schema ~/nyc-taxi-data/2009/01/data.parquet
   
   panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
   [signal SIGSEGV: segmentation violation code=0x2 addr=0x0 pc=0x100689fec]
   
   goroutine 1 [running]:
   github.com/apache/arrow/go/v7/parquet/file.NewParquetReader({0x100750e00, 0x14000138240}, {0x140001b1f38, 0x2, 0x2})
   	/Users/davidr/workspaces/zeroshade-arrow/go/parquet/file/file_reader.go:144 +0x7c
   github.com/apache/arrow/go/v7/parquet/file.OpenParquetFile({0x16f923984, 0x3f}, 0x0, {0x140001b1f38, 0x2, 0x2})
   	/Users/davidr/workspaces/zeroshade-arrow/go/parquet/file/file_reader.go:132 +0x110
   main.main()
   	/Users/davidr/workspaces/zeroshade-arrow/go/parquet/cmd/parquet_schema/main.go:37 +0xb8
   ```
   
   Any tips?


--

   I'm looking to get up to speed on the Go bindings through this PR, and so far I can get most of the tests to run (not including ones that require a `PARQUET_TEST_DATA` dir, which I'm not sure what to specify):

   ```sh
   main.main()
   ```

   @drauschenbach So that's actually a bug I found also and put up a PR for. It came about due to a change I made in the interface to simplify things and then I forgot to update the mainprogs. 
   
   Please try using the branch in PR: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12303 until it gets merged. Try that out and if it doesn't work let me know by commenting on that PR

   Also, in reference to the `PARQUET_TEST_DATA` env var mentioned above I found `ci/scripts/go_test.sh`, and that explains a required `-test` tag. But I also don't make it through that test suite. Many tests pass, until:
   
   ```
   $ ci/scripts/go_test.sh `pwd`
   ...
   ~/workspaces/zeroshade-arrow
   + export PARQUET_TEST_DATA=/Users/davidr/workspaces/zeroshade-arrow/cpp/submodules/parquet-testing/data
   + PARQUET_TEST_DATA=/Users/davidr/workspaces/zeroshade-arrow/cpp/submodules/parquet-testing/data

   ++ go list ./...
   ++ grep -v vendor
   + for d in '$(go list ./... | grep -v vendor)'
   + go test -race -tags assert github.com/apache/arrow/go/v7/parquet
   ok  	github.com/apache/arrow/go/v7/parquet	0.549s
   + for d in '$(go list ./... | grep -v vendor)'
   ```

zeroshade commented on pull request #12149:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12149#issuecomment-1025992928


   So, for the `PARQUET_TEST_DATA` it refers to the directory that pulls down the sample parquet files which are in the submodule loaded in the cpp source as you can see referenced by the value it is set to in that script.
   
   As far as that crash you are seeing, that's interesting and not one I had encountered. Judging from the directory paths I assume you're running this on a Mac using an ARM64 CPU?


--

fields.description: Last large portion of code to get merged. anything after this is individual bug fixes or improvements. With the exception of features that aren't yet implemented in Go (like Dictionary Arrays and such) this brings the Go Parquet library pretty much to mostly feature parity with the C++ Parquet Library.
fields.summary: [Go][Parquet] Add pqarrow package for direct Parquet <--> Arrow
